members.member:
A class that can be used to compute the Adler-32 checksum of a data stream. An Adler-32 checksum is almost as reliable as a CRC-32 but can be computed much faster. 1.00 12/25/2009 1.02 01/22/2018 Singyuen Yip / Ulysses
http://blog.163.com/light_warm/blog/static/3168104201001195634824/

member.name: M:FreeMote.Adler32.Update(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Updates checksum with specified array of bytes.
member.param: the byte array to update the checksum with

member.name: M:FreeMote.Adler32.Update(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates checksum with specified array of bytes.
member.param: the byte array to update the checksum with
the start offset of the data
the number of bytes to use for the update

member.name: M:FreeMote.Adler32.Reset
member.summary: Resets the checksum to its initial value.

member.name: M:FreeMote.Adler32.UpdateBytes(System.Int64,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computing the checksum based on the Adler Algorithm.
member.param: the start offset of the data
the number of bytes to use for the update

member.name: M:FreeMote.BitmapExtension.CopyRegion(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Copies a region of the source bitmap into this fast bitmap
member.param: The region on the source bitmap that will be copied over
The region on this fast bitmap that will be changed
member.exception: The provided source bitmap is the same bitmap locked in this FastBitmap

members.member:
Resize the image to the specified width and height.
The image to resize. The width to resize to. The height to resize to. The resized image. https://stackoverflow.com/a/24199315/4374462

member.name: T:FreeMote.BitmapHelper
member.summary: Image loading toolset class which corrects the bug that prevents paletted PNG images with transparency from being loaded as paletted.

member.name: M:FreeMote.BitmapHelper.LoadBitmap(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Loads an image, checks if it is a PNG containing palette transparency, and if so, ensures it loads correctly. The theory on the png internals can be found at http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/book/chapter08.html

member.name: M:FreeMote.BitmapHelper.FindChunk(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Finds the start of a png chunk. This assumes the image is already identified as PNG. It does not go over the first 8 bytes, but starts at the start of the header chunk.
member.param: The bytes of the png image.
The name of the chunk to find.
member.returns: The index of the start of the png chunk, or -1 if the chunk was not found.

member.name: M:FreeMote.BitmapHelper.CloneImage(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Clones an image object to free it from any backing resources. Code taken from http://stackoverflow.com/a/3661892/ with some extra fixes.

member.name: T:FreeMote.ColorConsole
member.summary: Console Color Helper class that provides coloring to individual commands

member.name: M:FreeMote.ColorConsole.WriteLine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes out a line with a specific color as a string
member.param: A console color. Must match ConsoleColors collection names (case insensitive)

member.name: M:FreeMote.ColorConsole.Write(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes out a line with color specified as a string
member.param: A console color. Must match ConsoleColors collection names (case insensitive)

member.name: M:FreeMote.ColorConsole.WriteWrappedHeader(System.String,System.Char,System.ConsoleColor,System.ConsoleColor)
member.summary: Writes a line of header text wrapped in a in a pair of lines of dashes: ----------- Header Text ----------- and allows you to specify a color for the header. The dashes are colored

member.name: M:FreeMote.ColorConsole.WriteEmbeddedColorLine(System.String,System.Nullable{System.ConsoleColor})
member.summary: Allows a string to be written with embedded color values using: This is [red]Red[/red] text and this is [cyan]Blue[/blue] text

member.name: M:FreeMote.ColorConsole.WriteInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Write a Info Line - dark cyan

member.name: F:FreeMote.Consts.NumberStringPrefix
member.summary: The string with this prefix will be convert to number when compile/decompile

member.name: F:FreeMote.Consts.ResourceIdentifier
member.summary: The string with this prefix (with ID followed) will be convert to resource when compile/decompile

member.name: F:FreeMote.Consts.ExtraResourceIdentifier
member.summary: The string with this prefix (with ID followed) will be convert to extra resource when compile/decompile

member.name: F:FreeMote.Consts.Context_UseFlattenArray
member.summary: (bool) Whether to decode and encode FlattenArray in extra resources (false by default)

member.name: F:FreeMote.Consts.Context_DisableCombinedImage
member.summary: (bool) (for ) If set to true, always use chunk (piece) images to compile rather than use the combined one

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.PsbDataStructureAlign
member.summary: Perform 16 byte data align or not (when build)

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.InMemoryLoading
member.summary: Take more memory when loading, but maybe faster

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.FastMode
member.summary: Use more inferences to make loading fast, set to False when something is wrong

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.StrictMode
member.summary: Use more strict checks and if conditions are not met, just terminate

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.JsonUseHexNumber
member.summary: Use hex numbers in json to keep all float numbers correct

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.JsonUseDoubleOnly
member.summary: Always use double instead of float

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.PsbObjectOrderByKey
member.summary: Whether to sort the object order by key when build PSB

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.FlattenArrayByDefault
member.summary: Always consider ExtraResource as FlattenArray of float unless it's not 4-bytes aligned

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.PaletteMerge
member.summary: (not implemented yet) Use Palette Merge will increase compile time but cut output size (only when using CI* images)

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.GeneratePalette
member.summary: (not used yet) Allows you to edit CI* images by re-generate the palette for each bppIndexed image (will increase size), otherwise you should not change those images

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.AllowRemovePalette
member.summary: When compile, FreeMote will try to convert images with palette to common images (without palette). The compiled size will increase.

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.PreferManaged
member.summary: Use managed code rather than external/native if possible

member.name: P:FreeMote.Consts.CombineAudioChannels
member.summary: (not implemented yet) If the audio have 2 channels, try to combine them when output wave

member.name: F:FreeMote.PsbAudioPan.LeftRight

summary.para: if encrypt v3-v4, will only encrypt header.
if encrypt v2, will only encrypt body(strings).
if decrypt, clean header and body both.

member.name: M:FreeMote.PsbFile.ParseHeader(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Parse PSB encrypted header with key

member.name: M:FreeMote.PsbFile.TestHeaderEncrypted
member.summary: Try to test if header is encrypted actually, based on assumption. Only work for E-mote PSB
member.returns: true if header seems to be encrypted

member.name: M:FreeMote.PsbFile.TestBodyEncrypted
member.summary: Try to test if body is encrypted actually, based on assumption. Only work for E-mote PSB
member.returns: true if body seems to be encrypted

member.returns: Unencrypted Header for reference. Usually you shouldn't use it.

member.summary: Test if the first 4 bytes belong to a correct PSB header

member.summary: Check signature and return shell type if possible; return if cannot recognize

member.name: F:FreeMote.PsbHeader.MAX_HEADER_LENGTH
member.summary: Max length of header AFAIK. Need to be fixed if there are longer headers exist.

member.name: F:FreeMote.PsbHeader.HeaderEncrypt
member.summary:
If 1, the header seems encrypted, which add more difficulty to us
But doesn't really matters since usually it's always encrypted in v3+
Note: GMMan's PSB doc said 1 for header encrypt and 2 for body encrypt. But my EMT PSBv2 encrypted samples are still using 0. So I still prefer

member.name: F:FreeMote.PsbHeader.HeaderLength
member.summary:
Header Length (or OffsetKeyIndexes for PSBv1)
Usually same as in v2+

member.name: F:FreeMote.PsbHeader.OffsetNames
member.summary:
Offset of Names
Usually the beginning of encryption in v2

member.name: F:FreeMote.PsbHeader.Checksum
member.summary:
[v3] Adler32 Checksum for header
Not always checked in v3. Sadly, it's always checked from v4, so we have to handle it.

member.name: F:FreeMote.PsbHeader.OffsetExtraChunkData
member.summary:
[v4]
If there are no data, same as

RGBA4444 & RGBA8 conversion
true: 4 to 8; false: 8 to 4 Shibuya Scramble!

member.name: M:System.IO.PathNetCore.GetRelativePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a relative path from one path to another. Paths will be resolved before calculating the difference. Default path comparison for the active platform will be used (OrdinalIgnoreCase for Windows or Mac, Ordinal for Unix).
member.param: The source path the output should be relative to. This path is always considered to be a directory.
member.returns: The relative path or if the paths don't share the same root.
member.exception: Thrown if or is null or an empty string.

member.name: P:System.IO.PathNetCore.StringComparison
member.summary: Returns a comparison that can be used to compare file and directory names for equality.

member.name: T:System.IO.PathInternalNetCore
member.summary: Contains internal path helpers that are shared between many projects.

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternalNetCore.AreRootsEqual(System.String,System.String,System.StringComparison)
member.summary: Returns true if the two paths have the same root

member.name: M:System.IO.PathInternalNetCore.GetRootLength(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the length of the root of the path (drive, share, etc.).

member.summary: True if the given character is a directory separator.

member.summary: Get the common path length from the start of the string.

member.summary: Gets the count of common characters from the left optionally ignoring case
